Summary Su Yan is an accomplished electro-mechanic design engineer, who has multidisciplinary knowledge and strong experience on RF medical device R& D, Design of Experience (DOE), Design for Manufacture (DOM) and statics analyses, six sigma process improvement experiences in electro-mechanic device/products. 
 
Also, she has strong knowledge and skills in system vibration control and precision positioning, which includes system modeling, system identification, advance control, system simulation, control system architecture design, control software development, control system implementation.

Experience Senior Mechanical Engineer Intel Corporation April 2014  – Present (1 year 5 months) Hillsboro, Oregon Heavily influenced product roadmap for client systems on multiple generations by highlighting key thermal/mechanical concerns and providing mitigation paths while minimizing negative impact to both Intel and external customers; provided comprehensive package- and system-level guidance to industry to enable smooth adoption and integration of Intel silicon into client systems; determined thermal specifications on client silicon by balancing Intel’s fabrication needs with customer needs; addressed key customers’ specific issues and concerns on short notice; developed test procedures for lab testing to validate analytical assumptions; mentored and provided dozens of technical training sessions to new hires and interns. Key contributions: 
• Instrumental in enabling industry to adopt Intel’s Core™ M silicon in passively cooled client systems for the first time, allowing customers to integrate high-performance silicon into light and sleek consumer devices; this addressed a crucial area in Intel’s strategic roadmap as a response to both internal and external calls for action in this segment. 
• Assessed risk factors in revolutionary 2018 product and proposed unique thermal solution that minimizes customer adoption burden while delivering adequate thermal budget, overcoming previously understood thermal limitations. 
• Set and ensured accurate product thermal recommendations on all client products for 2014 by working with factory and customer-facing organizations.  
• Resolved launch-gating issues on high publicity products, enabling timely production and shipment. Mechanical Engineer Intel Corporation February 2013  –  March 2014  (1 year 2 months) Hillsboro, Oregon Performed CFD analyses for passively cooled client systems, keeping within constraints such as maximum silicon junction temperature and ergonomic temperature specifications while minimizing costs to customers; analyzed package-level thermal densities and thermal solution requirements for all client mobile products; analyzed heat generation from wireless docking system components and possible mitigation methods. Key contributions: 
• Performed CFD analysis for Intel reference design of passively cooled tablet with groundbreaking thinness, unveiled at Computex 2014, unequivocally resetting the industry understanding of consumer device form factors and performance with Intel silicon. 
• Performed CFD analyses for key customer engagements, demonstrating feasibility of passively cooled systems with Intel silicon. Thermal Applications Engineer Intel Corporation August 2011  –  January 2013  (1 year 6 months) Hillsboro, Oregon Wrote and maintained customer enabling documents; provided CFD analysis to customers to demonstrate feasibility of space constrained form factors for both desktop and mobile segments. Key contributions: 
• Provided on-site customer training sessions in Oregon and California on thermal management with focus on Intel Turbo Boost Technology and Configurable Thermal Design Power. 
• Analyzed hundreds of customer system logs to identify sub-optimal settings and provided customized feedback per system; authored tool to optimize analysis time and increase accuracy. Summary Objective and Areas of Expertise: 
Senior mechanical engineer seeking a full-time position in product research, design and development. 
· Extensive experience in consumer electronic product architecture and design including; injection molded plastics, cast metal, sheet metal, and machined parts, organic surface modeling, ECAD integration, thermal analysis, EMI containment, custom cabling, cosmetic finishes and regulatory conformance. 
· Excellent communication skills supported with rich visuals and renderings. Ability to speak the language of and collaborate with multiple disciplines and suppliers both foreign and domestic. 
· Creative engineer and problem solver, passionate about product design that exceeds the user's expectations.
